title: Placidity
review: Its a calm serene n placid lake to begin with. one or two adventure activities r also there. People here r friendly. Rates r reasonable. I hired a boat for 400 rs.full family. 30 minutes r sufficient time to soak in rejuvenate ur mind

title: Beautiful
review: Naukuchiatal lake is very beautiful n serene. Since Naukuchital is not much commercialised yet, there was less crowd,which was the best part. There are lots of water activities available.we did boating and kayaking on this lake.

title: A morning well spent
review: There is direct access to the lake from within the resort. We went for canoe rides and boat rides in the lake.

title: Must visit lake amidst nature
review: You should definitely visit Naukuchiatal if you prefer a calm and peaceful vacation away from the hustle and bustle of the city. There are plenty of boutique resorts and hotels close to the lake. During your next trip around this part of the country, skip Nainital and go for Naukuchiatal.

title: Nice lake with all the adventure games
review: Nice lake with all the adventure games like zip lining, kayaking, paddle boating etc. There are not many places to eat nearby.

title: Serene green lake,
review: Beautiful placid lake ,had a lovely shikaara ride and a lake side KMVN property to just sit quietly and read

title: Picturesque.
review: Located at 4 km from Bhimtal, and 26 km from Nainital, the deepest of all the lakes in the Nainital region, Naukuchital is serene and picturesque lake, which offers numerous water sports if one has an appetite for adventure.

title: Pisturesque - Must visit
review: Located in Naukuchiatal. This lake has nine corners and it huge. Many cafes, restaurants , hotel options nearby. One can do boating as well.

title: A nice quiet lake
review: There are no touristic hordes around this lake. It is said that going around the nine corners of the lake gives moksha to the person.

title: A very nice lake
review: This is one of the better lakes of the Nainital Region. Clean and less crowded than the Naini Lake. Boating is quite economic here at just 300 rs for half round of lake. The best feature of this lake is that it has Shikara Boats, which will give you the feeling of Srinagar. KVMN restaurant and tourist house is just around the corner. Some games for children were also there. Many restaurants near the lake to fill your taste buds. So go and enjoy the Shikara boat.

title: Very good
review: True to nature its one of t beat place in nanital area. Less hyped more fun n fantastic views all arnd u. U r basically seeing a canvas in front of u. Its tat spectacular. Great place to chill. Hav ur hot coffee. Enjoy come water sports n activities wil keep u occupied. Over a good place to spend quality time.

title: Peaceful experience
review: Very nice lake. This lake is not very congested always as it is almost untoched beauty. Boating experience in the lake was very peaceful and pleasant.

title: Beautiful Lake surronded by Plush mountains visited by @GhumantuBaba
review: There are four famous lakes near Nainital/Bhimtal -> Nainital lake, Sattal, Bhimtal lake and Naukuchiatal. This Naukuchiatal is most beautiful and surrounded by green mountains and is just 5 kms from Bhimtal.

title: Beautiful
review: It's a beautiful lake away from all commercialisation. The place is preferred over Naini lake , if you want a calm lonely place with not much crowd .

title: Beautiful Naukuchiatal Lake
review: Naukuchiatal is also known as  ‘lake of nine corners’.

title: Boating & Water Sports!
review: At Naukuchiatal Lake you will find many boating options and sports to choose from, more than what you see at the Naini Lake in Nainital. The boats here looked much beautiful and colorful than what we had seen in Nainital’s main lake. The location and landscape is not as beautiful as the Naini and Bhimtal lakes.

title: Smaller but better than the other lakes!
review: Many don’t know about Naukuchiatal lake, it’s a smaller version of the Bhimtal lake only a couple of kms away. The market place is smaller, and there are few resorts to stay at making the place a whole less commercial than Bhimtal or Nainital. Definitely go here and try of Kayaking.

title: lotus in the lake
review: lotus in the lake looks beautiful, recommended to enjoy a boat ride at the lake and has good sports/games options for kids.

title: Lake Nakuchiatal
review: Tal means lake.So here in Utterkhand lake is doubled. So it was for little pun. Nakuchia means having 9 corners. This lake is really beautiful n serene, with forest and all green hills around with a winding road on one side. It is not that big compared to Bhimtal or Nainital. But has its own charm. Said to be not that crowded compared to Nainital. And this month being off season it was very peaceful. I also found 2 water purification plants at two oposite places, and so d lake waterlooks quite clean. It had 2 boating clubs. Ofcourse d 2 resorts around lake have there own boating facilities too. The one near unmaintained lotus pond I did not like much.

title: Beautiful
review: One of the lake so many there in the region of Nainital it is also a beautiful place to visit fun everywhere

title: Attractive Lake
review: The lake is very pretty. Right next to lo is a shallow pond with blossoming lotuses, a very pretty sight. Walking next to the lake is a pleasure as the place is not crowded

title: nice lake..
review: the lake and the surroundings are very quite, good for a relaxing weekend.  You can try your hands on fishing and boating apart from some adventure activities.

title: Naukuchital lake
review: Good place to hang around with family. You can do peddle boating even you can try shikara, if you are going as a couple or family... Wonderful experience. Just opposite this Tal there is Kamal Tal also. Where you can see 100s of Kamal / lotus flowers... Must visit once

title: Nice
review: Quieter version of Nainital and Bhimtal. Limited activities around. Good place for a cup of coffee or tea with Maggie. Tourism may turn out to be a bane for this place.

title: Nice place to relax for a while
review: Small place with lotus flowers around lake. Nice place to unwind and relax for a while. Boating and other activities available for kids.

title: Beautiful
review: Its a lovely locale..much less crowded than nainital or bhimtal..cleaner too..one can go for boating or kayaking.one end has beautiful lotus flowers.

title: Another clean lake near Bhimtal
review: It has nine corners, that is why it is called Naukuchiatal. Lots of sports activities near the lake.

title: Para gliding
review: Paragliding by Himalayan Adventures is just very safe and their troopers are very good. They adhere to all safety norms.

title: Beautiful place for boating
review: A huge 9 edged, 175 feet deep lake was the best thing.

title: Lake with 9 corners
review: As the name suggests, it is a lake with 9 corners. This lake is good as compared to Naini lake or Bhimtal lake as well as less crowded compared to other 2 lakes. Visit it once.

title: Away from the commercialzation of Nainital
review: People who plan Nainital, I always suggest them this place. I have recently been there. The lake is serene and looks exotic, thanks to the dirty hands of commercialization that hasnt touched it yet. There is boating facility in the lake along with kayaks. You can enjoy half an hour of boat ride in the tranquil Nuakuchiatal in just Rs 300 per group of 6, which is damn cheap. There are a lot of tea and maggi shops around to lend you that Himalayan feel.

title: Do visit this place for PARAGLIDING
review: Besides enjoying lake and the view, the reason one should go to Naukuchiatal is Paragliding. Instead of negotiating with brokers waiting at the bottom of the hill, straight away drive to almost top of the hill, till your car can go, you will find direct centers there and you can get better deal there. Some photographers will be waiting for you when you reach the valley after paragliding, they do pretty decent photography and recording. You again need to bargain here :)

title: Nice lake with water sports activities
review: This is 13 km away from Nainital and near to Bhimtal. This is good location for water sports and kayaking.

title: Amazing Lake
review: Much more beautiful lake than Nainital and Bhimtal, very peaceful and wide lake. There are more options of adventures like boating, paragliding, etc. Just chill and relax to sit here, not much crowd all where.

title: Another Lake in the Hills of Nainital
review: Nice lake but it about 30 kms from the city centre.  Not much other thing to see there.  One can go there if they are covering Bhimtaal with it

title: Nice little place to spend the evening with friends & family
review: They say that this lake has 9 corners, so its call Nau-kuchia-tal (9-corner-lake).

title: Clean and quiet lake
review: The lake is vast, clean and spectacular. Unlike Naini lake which is quite a busy lake with lots of boats, this in contrast is not quite a happening place. However it offers shikara types of boats and is some what expensive than boats offered in Naini lake. The place also has lots of eateries and an adventure sport area for children.

title: Serene and tranquil
review: lots of activities to be done on the lake - kayaking, zorbing, boating, zipline, as well as around the lake,

title: A large delight
review: This lake is quite big and holds religious significance too. Plenty of activities are available or you can simply walk around and watch birds sweeping in to catch fish. The lake is surrounded by restaurants & cafes; one can easily spend an entire evening here.

title: Naukuchiatal  lake is unique because it has nine corners and located in a beautiful spot surrounded by forests.
review: It was a  friend who recommended this place for a week end stay. The Lake resort owned by Mahender Verma  turned out to be not only peaceful but also you wake up to a picturesque lake in front of you. Boating is  in the morning is a must as the boat takes you to all corners. I We had the advantage because our resort was facing the lake. Fortunately, the pristine beauty of the lake has been maintained. I would strongly recommend a visit , perhaps in March - April which is the best time, There are many places around the lake like Bhimtal and one can even take a trip to Nainital.

title: Under appreciated beautiful lake!
review: If one wants to be at a beautiful location but isolated at the same time and less crowded then Naukuchiatal is the best place to be. Many people still don’t know about this place which is at 1200 height from sea level and 6 km from Bhimtal. It’s far better than Nainital and very pleasant by view. The lake side resorts are the hidden gems in the midst of hilly jungles.

title: Superb experience
review: We were staying at Bhimtal - so this lake was only 15 mins drive ; we parked a little way up in a field in front of few shops and then walked down about 200m.

title: Deepest lake in the vicinity
review: Lot of options for family outing here, Peaceful location, its better than Bhimtaal as it is less crowded.

title: Not a great lake...other than boating, nothing to do
review: We visited the lake tour (Bhimtal, Sattal, Naukuchiatal, Hanuman temple) with a drop to Kathgodam to railway station on 21st Mar. We booked a cab for 1700 for this trip. It is cheaper by about 200-300 rs. as tour guides in Nainital were asking about 2000. The drivers no. is 9410515185 (Hafeez Ahmed). very good and cooperative guy.

title: Nothing found any specilaity
review: During out tour of Uttarkhanda, we visit this famous lake in the hilly region. The place was crowded.

title: best in bhimtal
review: One of the best hotel in Bhimtal very good decorated room and the surrounding area very neat and clean

title: UPL Ltd
review: Good place away from the highway. Nice sceneries and ambience. Limited facilities no dressing table in rooms. However awesome stay due to the hospitality of Bilam and her team. Good food

title: Great place - Chick clean
review: Must visit this lake. It is far better than Nainital. It is super clean and have calm surroundings. It also have some food joints where you can get homely food as well. Junk food options are also there in case that’s your taste. Boating rates are reasonable as well.

title: Hidden Gem
review: This place is a heaven if you'd like a secluded stop in the hills away from Bhimtal and Nainital which are usually very crowded. The cottages here are very basic. But the outdoors are so peaceful and beautiful you don't feel like stepping inside!!

title: Nice place for Water sports and paragliding
review: On the way to Naukuchiatal there is hill for paragliding. They charge 1500 Rs per person for small paragliding. Its thrilling experience. at Naukuchiatal you can do cross river wire gliding. Its really fun for kids and youngsters.

title: Holiday with friends
review: The resort is located at a hill top overlooking the lake. Being on the hill top it offers two scenic views, one overlooking the lake and the Valley the other facing Virgin hills & forest ( found the other view more pleasant and unique as this view is unique to this resort).

title: Beautiful Boating experience
review: The lake & the lake town is in a quest corner of Nanital district, this is what makes the boating experience unique. The Naukuchiatal lake is the biggest lake and has a unique shape having 9 corners hence the name Naukuchia. Except in the peak summer season one can enjoy the boat ride in peace and soak in the fresh breezy air. Highly recommended!

title: Weekend trip
review: This place is fully equipped with natural beauty along with a lot of water sports activities in this lake.adjecent to lotus lake.

title: Beautiful and peaceful lake
review: The lake has a secret with one of the largest lotus ponds at its entrance and often it goes un-noticed. Another one is the Har ki Paidi temple just below the TRC/KMVN.

title: Quiet Getaway
review: About 25 kms away from Nainital lies this beautiful lake. Unlike the Nainital Lake, which has tons of people, this one is less populated and hence one can relax and calmly enjoy its beauty. There are some options of boating etc. available too.

title: Bike ride
review: Crowded and not many facilities are available. There are few adventure activities that are conducted

title: Activites
review: We did kayaking and zorbing at the lake. We had a blast zorbing since we were a big group and the staff was polite and helpful.

title: Good Lake
review: This one lake is very good and big lake but less populate.Lots of water activities to be done here.The scenic beauty of this lake also very good.

title: The 9 cornered lake
review: Nanital is the lake district of India and Naukuichiatal is one of the more interesting lakes close to Bhimtal. The name Naukuchiatal  implies that it has 9 corners and the legend is that all the corners cannot be seen from any part of the world. The lake has a road running half around it and terminates abruptly at the rear entrance of a resort.

title: Peaceful..!!
review: Nice lake.. it's quite big in size and very less crowded unlike nainital lake. The boats here can accommodate six adults at least and  are covered. More like a Shikara but they are expensive...!!

title: Best lake in Nanital district!!
review: Naukuchiatal is the best lake in this region in terms of preserved natural beauty, calmness, water sports and cleanliness!

title: Naukuchiatal lake
review: It is supposed to be the deepest lake in the Kumaon region and the name has derived from the fact that it has 9 corners and the local folklore says anybody who can see the nine corners at the same time will have lady luck on his side. It is the only lake in this region where you can also take a shikara ride

title: Beautiful and serene
review: Naukuchiatal is one of the prettier and bigger lakes in the Lake district of Kumaon Himalayas. It offers a number of water sports and paragliding opportunities close by if one has an appetite for adventure

title: Great
review: Good place. Zipline river crossing, kayaking and boat rides were enjoyed by children. Good coffee and snacks by lakeside. Nice view of mountains.

title: a very quite lake less tourist
review: the lake is very quite .. ideal for bird watching people.... boating can be done  and more fun filled then nainital and bhimtal....  try kayaking and swimming...

title: Visit to Naukuchiatal
review: We went in month of June when it was raining all over. Lake looked beautiful from our lake facing cottage. There were  a lot of activities for tourist like boating etc. Paragliding was also available nearby.Small outlets for snacks, meals were spread all over. Overall this place is worth going because it is less crowded than Nainital.

title: Calm and peaceful place
review: Very close to Delhi, a place that offers complete serenity calm and peace amidst the jungle.

title: serene waters
review: by far the best of the lakes in the lake district of kumaon, very green , peaceful and clean water, wish tourists wouldn

title: Iconic and mesmraising
review: This lake is the largest lake in Kumaun Region, it is also pristine and Clean. Its about 30 KM from Nainital so less crowded. Boating is available and it was awesome

title: Isolated peace
review: Much better weekend gateway!! Isolated from daily city life....nine corner lake among one of nainital lake...located near khatgodam n bhimtal

title: nice lake with some activities
review: A big lake where you can do activities like kyaking, zip line , paragliding etc,

title: Lake with amazing beauty
review: Naukuchiatal or ‘lake of nine corners is situated at Nainital district in Uttarakhand surrounded with hills and full off greenery. Shadows of green tree and hills in water is presenting very beautiful view, apart from this God made live duck and man made duck shape boats adding the additional amazing beauty in the view. It is very calm, peaceful and photogenic place for all nature lovers.

title: Serene beauty, flawless
review: Do not visit if you are fond of visiting places full of tourists. Hardly 10% of total tourists to Nainital visits this place. May be that is the reason why this is a calm, quiet and well maintained place. Hire a boat and enjoy the water and the peace.

title: Peaceful
review: Lake of 9 corners is mainly clean except where the boats (Shikara), kayaks and those floating large cylinders in which have to run to move.

title: Best place for boating
review: Neat and clean lake. Boating and kayak is also available and boats are in much better condition than in Nainital.. Kayak experience was great

title: best lake for kayaking and boating
review: went there with my friends and kids, its a great place and well maintained lake...we did boating as well as kayaking...it was real fun...must visit place

title: Good for family holidays
review: This is located near Bhimtal. This is relatively better place than bhimtal with less no. Of resorts and hotels. The quality of the water in lake is also good. This is little bit secluded place but has good boating and bird watching options. If want to have a cutoff from the world and relax this is a good place. Generally this place is much colder that bhimtal and Nainital.

title: Must visit on nainital trip
review: I found this lake the most beautiful among all the lakes in and around nainital. Dont miss it! Take a boat ride its totally worth it.

title: Quite lake
review: Beautiful lake with nine corners and surrounded by hills.Water is very clean. can enjoy kayaking and boating on the lake.

title: Beutiful lake
review: It is a big lake. Good place for walking in morning. All sort of options are available for boating as per your choice. Prices are fixed and mentioned on the boards. However you can negotiate the time in off season

title: Good place for boating
review: Too crowded in the peak season. However less crowded than Nainital. Also bigger than it.

title: Good place for boating provided it is a good weather!!
review: We visited this lake in June 2016 and enjoyed boating in kashmiri shikaara. Even though it was a bit hot, the boat ride was enjoyable. However, the place certainly needs to improve its public conveniences infrastructure. Needs focus to develop this place as a good tourist attraction.

title: NAUKUCHIATAL
review: It's a fun place for children. They have paragliding, boating for youngsters. We stayed in Majkhali and visited this place on the way back.

title: Nakuchiyatal Lake
review: Nakuchiyatal Lake,  There is no heaven on earth....... just little pieces of it. We had explore  3 to 4 hrs at that place. A perfect beautiful place also available for tempting challenges like paragliding, fishing, rowing, paddling or yachting. Naukuchiatal is also famous for the escape festival.  We had enjoyed  Boating and paragliding. Really great memories.

title: NINE CORNERED LAKE
review: In this area lots of lakes Nainital lake at Naintal , Bhimtal, SautTal lake etc.

title: Beautiful Lake
review: This lake is beautiful with full of greenery around ,we did boating in this lake and the experience was very good. there are few water sports are  also available. Worth visiting this place if you are  visiting Nainital.

title: Away from the maddening crowd
review: Firstly, the lake is bigger than the better known Nainital and Bhimtal. Secondly, the crowds don't get here. The result a wonderful time for boating zip lining and other water front activities. I suggest going to the end of the road around the lake to get better deals.  A hot veg Maggi and masala thumbs up is highly recommended.

title: nature's gift to mankind
review: The name implies a 9 cornered lake. It. is beautiful, placid in the morning and shimmering when the  sun comes up.Picture perfect, God's priceless gift to the land of gods and goddesses - Dev Bhumi.

title: lake view Hunting Lodge
review: I stayed here for 2 days with my family and the place is  bang opposite a lake, a great location with lots of greenery and variety of birds to watch at.  Delicious food and excellent services. The staff was really co operative and the service was appreciably great. The owners are welcoming and the place is clean and restful. We had booked the hunting lodge with huge open garden ,Lake view and jungle view. All the amenities and facilities were provided. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and relatives.

title: Amazing
review: Great lake  loved it. Loved water sports. Everythng was amazing. Faaaaaaar better than najnital or bhimtal. Peaceful and beautiful

title: Another Lake
review: 4 km north from Bhimtal is Naukuchiyatal, which has nine corners and that is why the lake is named naukuchiya. 175 ft deep. All activities are here like paragliding, fishing, rowing, paddling, yachting, zorbing etc. An ideal place for family picnic. Paragliding charges around 1500/- and it is 3 km way from lake. This place is 23 km from nainital and having good hotel & resort if you want to stay instead of nainital.

title: Relaxing trip
review: Stayed in resort for 3 days beautiful location

title: Nice lake with lot of activities
review: This is a beautiful lake near Nainital with plenty of activities - paragliding, kayaking, and boating. There are nice resorts nearby but not many. Unlike nainital, this is less commercialised. The only change i would recommend is for authorities to install lights on the road around the lake as it can get pitch black in the night.

title: Boating
review: This tal is having nice boating and kayaking facilities. Also site for paragliding is not far from here so for activities like kayaking, boating, paragliding etc this is suitable place

title: Calm and serene with no motor noise and hand rowed boats
review: The lake is picturesque surrounded by hills. There are no motor boats and only hand rowed boats  are allowed which makes the boating experience awesome and peaceful! The rowers are locals and tell you lovely tales associated with the lake!! It has 9 corners and an hour long boatride covers it all! Best time to row is morning or evenjng at sunset!

title: Clean lake, peaceful area
review: Naukutchiatal is an ideal place for those who want to get away from the hustle bustle of cities and the mad rush at Nainital. Very peaceful, not yet commercialized.

title: Best out of all Taals
review: I like this and did boating also .in my opinion it was best amongst all other tails and the boating experience was awsum

title: Best Lake full. Of adventure sport around it
review: It would be better to visit during off season as you would be able. To enjoy the sports much more and also at better rates.. In the season they tend to over charge and also hurry things up as there is always a queue behind you. The late itself has boating, kayaking, and zorping tubes.  All In all. The best. Among all. Lakes. Of. Nainital.

title: Naukuchiatal Lake
review: Famous for its nine corners, simply pure and clean water.A must visit for travellers visiting Corbett and Nainital and beyond.

title: Serene and beautiful experience
review: Naukuchiatal lake competes for its glory along with elder sisters like Nainital and Bhimtal. Little away from maddening crowds at Nainital, this lake offers the tranquility that is otherwise missing at Nainital. The lake in itself is pretty big and surrounded by meadows. There are three access points : two where you can get boats for enjoying boating while the far end has big resorts like Club Mahindra and others at the entrance along with few private properties. The best part of this lake is the serene and calm environment as not many people know about this or care to reach this far. So if you want to sit by the lake and spend your time, this is a very good choice

title: Very beautiful lake
review: Was blown away by the peace and quiet of the lake despite a lot of tourists. A boat ride around the lake is a must if you really want to appreciate the beauty of this nine cornered lake.

title: Unspoiled, clean and quiet Lake.
review: Naukuchiatal is reasonably big ( one round along the lake is about 4 Kms approx.). It is clean and we noticed that a project to Oxigenate the lake is on. You will noice big rounds of water in between the lake as countinios cleaning and airing is going on.

title: A lake with nine corners
review: Another spectacular lake 4km. towards north from Bhimtal is Naukuchiyatal which has nine corners and that is why the lake is named naukuchiya. The lake is the deepest of all  the lakes in kumaun region with 175ft.depth at 1220mts. above sea level.The lake is surrounded by hills with tall trees all over. Full of activities are here like paragliding, fishing, rowing, paddling, yachting, zorbing etc. one can enjoy to the fullest. An ideal place for family picnic. A must visit place in Kumaun Uttarakhand.  Ashit Kumar Das.

title: Not worth to go
review: This place should not be considered for sightseeing. place is full of rowdy elements. lake is also very dirty and not maintained.

title: Kayaking & Paragliding in Naukuchiatal
review: Loved the kayaking in naukuchia tal. It was very peaceful and beautiful. They are offering many more watersports at very affordable rates there. Paragliding was also fun as well as adventurous.

title: Also a serene and peaceful experience
review: Probably the cleanest and serene portion in this area. The good part it has good resorts around and no commercial establishments

title: serene and not much explored
review: This lake still enjoys the serenity of the nature as not many people go there yet. The beautiful green lake soothes the tired eyes and mind.. one can enjoy just by sitting by th elake of boating/ kayak/ zipping/ horse-riding. Couple of small cafes offers enough to spend ample time there..

title: Peaceful lake
review: Its a lake which has nine corners and hence the name. Did 30 mins of boating which covers half of the lake. The lake is clean and not very crowded. For better experience use the rear access to the lake which is at the end of the road. There are a few noodle stalls and small eateries to grab a bite or two.

title: Nice lake
review: It's located away from the hustle bustel of Nainital town.

title: Serene, beautiful and clean lake!
review: The lake offers beautiful views of the hills around, whether boating, kayaking or zorbing , it gives a refreshing experience and has been maintained very well by the govt in terms of cleanliness , impressed to see that there is no garbage dumping in the lake which happens in most of the lakes. Boating along the nine corners of the lake takes one across all the properties by the lake. Must do when in Naukuchiatal.

title: 9 Corners Lake
review: As locals said the lake having 9 corners, but you can't visit all 9 corners on foot.

title: Serene Lake
review: Clean lake with a Lot of fun activities.

title: Tranquil experience
review: I spent the last night of a 3 night 4-day tour to Nainital in naukuchiatal. I stayed at one of the bungalows lakeside of leisure group right next to the club mahindra property. There was a separate way leading right down to the lake from the property. The lake is beautiful and really big, but not as clean as the naini lake or the bhimtal lake. It is more deserted than Naina lake. Not sure how safe the water sports are. But natural beauty at its best!

title: Awsome!
review: Visited with friends had a fantastic time. Lots of activities for all ages. The great thing is that it is far from the maddening crowds of Nainital and is hauntingly beautiful. Am definitely coming back again.

title: Good place to visit for first time tourists
review: A nice place for tourist but for my kind of regulars, not so appealing. I suggest not to visit the place during summer afternoons, as it may be hot. For winters and spring, it is good place, specially for honeymoon couples and kids.

title: Nine corners of the lake
review: This lake has a lot to offer. Boating, Kayaking, Zorbing and Peace. If you are looking for all this, then you can always visit this lake.

title: Very calm place to hangout with loved one
review: Very calm place to hangout with loved ones, one's can enjoy boating and roam around and can go for hike.

title: Beautiful
review: Go there and i think so you must enjoy  boat ride here. Go for boat ride  here not in bhimtal. I suggest to take that boat that can be driven by you don't take anytype of motor boat. Take paddle boat or if you are single or double not a family  than take kayak.

title: The lake
review: One of the most breathtaking lakes of India. Serene and scenic.. I have been to a number of lakes in India and abroad, and the Naukuchiatal lake is one of the most charming and well maintained lakes I have ever visited. The area around the lake is clean and green. A place where the poet inside you can simply come to life.. most recommended..

title: scenic beauty away from city
review: lake is around 26 kms away from nainital city.... lake is b'ful surrounded by mountains. one can njoy boating wth family in lake. quiet nd calm away from the hustle & bustle of the city

title: Comfortable and Homely Stay
review: Excellent Hotel, Lovely owners, Super service and tasty food. Awesome experience. Must visit and stay in the valley facing rooms.

title: Beautiful lake with great surroundings
review: This place has preserve the nature and that is what matter. It also provide many water activity like Kayaking, boating etc.

title: Small & Sweet
review: Its a beautiful lake where you will enjoy the walk around it. The place is secluded with only a few shops to give you company.

title: Nice lake
review: The lake is beautiful and and is less crowded than bhimtal and nainital.This lake has boating and kayaking facilities.

title: Beautiful lake
review: One of beautiful lake in city of lakes but not maintained properly otherwise good to visit for short time as compare to Bhimtal or Naini Lake,befor entry now u can see Kamal Flowers lake but with full of dirt

title: Nice
review: The lake was good. Not much crowded. You can spend some sweet time here and also do some adventure sports if you like. They have kayaking which is a must try!

title: Quaint lake surrounded by resorts
review: The name of the lake is derived from the fact that it has 9 corners. Also there is a saying that whoever can view all 9 corners by standing at a corner can attain nirvana. Boating charges are Rs. 400 for 30 mins. Not as commercialized area as Nainital but the lake has its own charm.

title: New year eve
review: I joined new year Eve at cm Naukuchiatal 'it is memorable experience for magical Eve in my life.

title: Kayaking at Naukuchiatal Lake
review: If you are in naukuchiatal, do go for kayaking in the lake.

title: Fun visit
review: The lake is huge. Loved boating. There is also a shikara option if you want. Beautiful scenery and a very well maintained lake.

title: Nature at its best
review: The lake, the parasailing the nature awesome..Ville Paradise is a fantastic property with the owners paying full attention to its functioning and customer experience. As the name suggest to visit this place is Naukuchiatal or ‘lake of nine corners’ is a small beautiful hill station in Nainital district of the Indian state of Uttarakhand. The food, the activities and most important is the staff is really too good. You feel like home away from home concept. Excellent rooms. Services. Food. Location.Just perfect .outstanding

title: Beautiful lake
review: As beautiful as any other lake in kumayun.there is a small lake/ pond near it which gets full of lotus in May/june

title: Nice clean non commercial environment to allow you to enjoy nature
review: Feel close to nature and activities like kayaking zorbing etc . Can spend many enjoyable days in the vicinity.

title: Naveen Saxena
review: A very nice . quite & peaceful stay. Stayed for about 6 days. Beautiful view of the lake. Very relaxing. Love to go back soon.

title: Marvellous Lake
review: Boating in the lake was a great pleasure. The water was very clean. Lake water was calm. The boatmen were polite and friendly.

title: Cool and Relaxing
review: This Lake is located at an end and therefore attracts less crowd than Nainital and Bhimtal. Really a nice place to visit and a visit is definitely recommended.

title: Another Lake in Nainital District
review: Naukuchiatal Lake is 5 kilometers away from Bhimtal Lake. As it is away, it is less crowded. The water in this lake was clean and i also saw lotus flowers in this lake. I also did boating here which was a memorable event.

title: nice peaceful
review: you can just walk near the lake...its so cute!! i wish there were a few points where you could sit and enjoy the lake!!

title: serene awesome
review: boating was great, carry some bread if you want to feed the fish and ducks... boats take 4 people 2 adults and 2 kids

title: Lotus blooms
review: We walked across to the lake from our resort (Club Mahindra). A nice, pleasant walk. The lotus were resting at that time. The person manning the roundabout was covering it. A few people accosted us to the Kashmir stall, where they were selling something called Kiddy, but we told them we would return the next morning. On the way back, two men on horses offered lifts to the resort, but we preferred to walk.

title: BLUE WTAER SOOTHS BLUE MOODS
review: It is serene,water and bird watching takes away your stresses. Idle walk along lake, boating and seeing Lotus at Lotus Taal if makes rejuvenated,Naukuchiatal is an ideal place. For those who can not walk, there is no pleasure.

title: Water Sports
review: You can do a variety of Water Sports , and boating in Naukuhiatal , and their is a Kamal Taal just oppsite to Naukuchiatal , In Kamal tal , lots  of lotus Flowers are Blossoming

title: Simply Awesome
review: If you plan to visit Nainital, do stay at Naukuchiatal.  The atmosphe is serene and the lake magical. Enjoy boatrides and other sporting activities too. Just loved the place and would want to return some day.

title: Peaceful, tourist friendly
review: This lesser known cousin of Nainital is actually much better. 1/10th the crowd, no dirt / garbage / pollution. Limited hotels, limited locals and what views.

title: Much peaceful than Nanital & Bhimtal
review: Clean and serene. Has good resorts around and also has option of choosing Kumoan Mnadal resort. Though the temperature of bit warmer than Nanital.

title: Nice
review: Not much to do but over all a nice and a quite lake with some basic water sport and activities.

title: Scenic and Serene
review: A scenic 40-minute drive from Nainital through Bhowali will take you to Naukuchiyatal. The lake appears to be much bigger than the Naini Lake and the view around is gorgeous. The lake is clean and the surroundings are very peaceful, unlike the crowded Nainital. Boating in the lake is the main attraction here. You can hire a paddle boat, a row-boat with an attendant or even a kayak if you feel more adventurous. The lake is surrounded by gently rolling mountains that have some nice resorts if you wish to stay here. There are a few eateries near the boating points where you get basic fare like tea, coffee, lemon-soda, pakoras and maggie.

title: Awesome Tour
review: We went with a group of friends. Though We reached late at night yet the staff welcomed us warmly and served dinner. We all enjoyed a lot as the hotel organised adventure activities and bon fire for us. Food was awesome. Rooms were very neat and clean. Very supportive staff and nice hospitality. Overall a memorable vacations for all of us.

title: Naukuchiatal Lake
review: one of the best tals in the area....quite big..offers boating / kayaking..very good. Market by the side of the lake....Horse riding...restaurants.. walk around the lake.

title: Less explored and crowded beautiful lake
review: A lake located very near to nainital, yet much less crowded with nice boating options. The surrounding is also very scenic and there is a beautiful hanuman temple.

title: Calm lake with good boating activities
review: This lake is around 4 kms away from Bhimtal. It is least explored lake and hence more clean and unspoilt. Options available for boating and  kayaking. Nice views around the lake

title: Beautiful Lake With lot to do
review: It's just not a beautiful Lake, it itself is an experience..  We tried Kayaking though we don't know swimming and were apprehensive in the beginning but it turned out to be one of the best experience.

title: Simply paradisaical
review: The unruffled waters fenced in with the majestic mountains, is an enormous reservoir of solace and tranquil

title: A quiet surroundings
review: A nice mid sized lake which is not much commercialised.. Boating options are available.. Loved to walk around it ..

title: Beautiful.. Lotus pond...water sports...Shed boating...Local shopping
review: Must visit. It is one of the nine lakes in Nainital. It is around 25 km from Nainital. The main three lakes namely Bhim Tal, Sat Tal and Navkuchiya Tal are situated in the close vicinity at a distance of 5 km or so. This lake has boats with shades (Shikara)  which shall make your boating comfortable even in sunny day. Secondly its cheaper at around Rs 300 as against higher than this rates at Bhimtal. One can also find the water rolling balloons which are normally enjoyed by kids. D o not forget to observe the beautiful ducks with different shades of feathers and beaks wandering along the / inside lakes. There is also a Lotus (Not lilly) pond next to this lake and you can get to take some close ups and enjoy the beauty of this national flower. Kashmir Emporium is available near it wherein one can do shopping for shawls etc. On the way to this lake you will find a big idol of Shri Hanumanji which is a must visit place for all devotees.

title: Nice clean and quiet lake, good for boating
review: We had shikara ride which was very nice, the staff is very informative and cooperative. I loved the place,

title: Nice and quiet lake
review: Unlike Naini lake where you see every tom dick and harry, this place is quiet. And boats are quite better.

title: A cool getaway from overcrowded hill stations in the hills.
review: KMVN Naukuchiyatal is ideally located about 35 kms from famous hill station Nainital which in peak season is so crowded that it's impossible to find a decent hotel there. This is where Naukuchiyatal takes Brownie's points a smaller locality quite and serene atmosphere is like a breath of fresh air. It's calm atmosphere attract many intellectual to stay there n get on with their literary work in the calm environment. Ideally located on lake which has many water sports facilities. The staff also is very helpful n courteous. Tourists can enjoy Paragliding too. Many other tourists attractions are at a few hours drive. For those who aren't to fond of hill driving can spend their time enjoying the peaceful and serene climate there.

title: Greeted with a riot of lotus blooms!
review: It was raining when we arrived at Naukuchiatal lake and the vision of the lotus blooms spread out on one side , took our breathe away. There are steps leading down to the edge of the water , where we could sit and enjoy the tranquility. The soft pink hues of the flowers were a delight. If you take your time and walk around, you will spot these bluish-grey set of birds who reside on a low hanging tree. Very busy set with a lovely chirping sound , we could have easily spent an hour just watching them. Loved visiting this lake just for the lotuses.

title: Beautiful lake
review: lake with nine corners surrounded by lush greenary. many water activities available such as kayaking ,boating etc.

title: Unkempt and commercialised place
review: Visited with family. Very poorly maintained and all the eating places near it are substandard and dirty. Very disappointed after a long drive from Mukteshwar. Nothing to do as the place is dirty and no decent place to sit.

title: Tranquil waters
review: The nine cornered lake is huge and unless ventured with boats cannot be covered. It is surrounded by mountains and there is no single spot that gives a full view. However it's a nice place to stay quieter from the crowded & commercialized Nainital or Bhimtal. Also one can see lots of birds and monkeys (which can be menacing as they do try to enter hotel rooms in search of food).

title: Calm & beautiful
review: The best thing in Nainital is all the beautiful lakes - be it the Naini lake, Bhimtal, Sattal or Naukuchiatal. Go there to enjoy the weather and the calm and beautiful lake. A lot of activities to do - kayaking, zorbing, river crossing.

title: Excellent Natural Lake
review: What a scenic beauty. Doing boating in this lake is par excellent. Surroundins are marvolous. Nature at its utmost.

title: LAKE IN LAP OF HILLS : A SOOTHING TRIP
review: Naukuchiatal is a tal (lake) created by nature and is about 35 km from Haldwani (Nainital). It is a fun for family. Boating in the lake which is surrounded by lush green hills provide an extraordinary calmness. Variety of birds are good attraction for bird watching. Water rolling (zorbing) is a fun for children.

title: Romantic & Pleasant tal (lake) in Nainital/Bhimtal area
review: This lake is called Naukuchia as it's having 9 corners and this lake is having many options to enjoy on water. We can take boat/shikara to experience pleasant & calm lake.

title: Nice place for boating
review: I would recommend lake at Naukuchiatal ahead of Bhimtal for boating. Here you have boats for groups as well, lets say for two families together, which is not the case at Nainital.

title: Less explored than Nainital
review: I appreciated Naukuchiatal lake only after a visit to Nainital lake, because compared to Nainital lake, this lake is a little cleaner and less crowded. But it isn't something that I would want to revisit.

title: A happening lake with all activities
review: A scenic large lake in comparison to other nearby lakes. lots of water sports available here. did some boating and kayaking here. visited again during morning walk..a very cool calm and serene area.. beware of monkeys..overall a must place to visit if you are visiting this side of Nainital

title: Quiet lake
review: Very nice quiet lake with few tourists. It has very few resorts around it. You can do boating, kayaking and zorbing.

title: Far from the Madding Crowd
review: Nakuchiatal is a much smaller place than Nainital and Bhimtal.It is much less crowded and hence, at least for the people who enjoypeace and quiet, it would be more enjoyable. There are resorts on the surrounding slopes overlooking the lake, where stay would be enjoyable. This time we paid a flying visit, but would definitely would like to visit for a longer stay.

title: Relaxing and peaceful trip!!!
review: Naukuchiatal is far better than Nainital. As nainital is so much crowded and commercialized and if you are a nature's lover then definitely you are going to like the place. This place is far off from the city and madding crowd. However, we didn't stay there and we really regret not staying here. We went for a day drive over here and like the place, the roads are clean, less crowded and very green.

title: Peaceful place to roam around and evening walk.
review: Peaceful place to roam around and evening walk. Boating and paddling options also available. Now a maintained lake.

title: Very nice lake
review: Better than Nainital. We enjoyed the boating there. Less costly and serene beauty. Lake is quite large and very good for relaxing holiday.

title: Peaceful and not crowded
review: You should rather come here than go to popular more expensive and crowded Nanitaal. Beautiful place.

title: smaller than bhimtal and nainital
review: not as peaceful than other lake. 5 km from bhimtal lake . one can visit this as a lake tour around nainital

title: Lake with 9 Corners
review: A medium sized lake with 9 corners, this is a good picnic attraction and good for a half day outing with family.

title: Clean lake with tons of water activity. Crowded though
review: Its a beautiful lake and in the right weather a pleasure to be at. It is not as crowded as the Bhimtal lake but can still end up with hoards on weekends.

title: Pleasent walk around
review: Apart from boating, you could do some paragliding here and take a cool walk around the lake and the bazaar

title: Calm and amazing
review: This place is not visited by many people and is a quite hangout. lovely lake and a beautiful view. have visited the place about 5 to 6 times. Every time you feel fresh.

title: skip Nainital for this place!!
review: We stayed here for one night during the off season and it was all worth it. We did kayaking and wonderful nature trails and treks. You have the option of even para sailing and taking a ride on an all terrain vehicle. The lake is bigger and more beautiful. Quite and serene and scenic.

title: Nice and quiet
review: Been there a couple of times with friends and family.

title: Amazingly beautiful lake.
review: Nothing can be so beautiful, calm, picturesque and worth visiting. You may spend the whole day or days even in this atmosphere.

title: Amazing lake with 9 corners
review: Absolutely amazing lake with clear water and absolute peace. One must do the boating here of complete lake. Very beautiful lake and very calm atmosphere.

title: beautiful
review: Words fail to describe it. It is simply magical. A little gem hidden away in the mountains. Have to do the paragliding if your there its a fantastic experience.

title: Canoeing in the lake
review: Was very nice ...kept clean also the local Authorizes effort in keeping the  lake alive by having oxygen pumped in to the lake. Had an hours session canoeing...the whole family loved it

title: Nice, Small Place
review: This review is a bit late - we share our experience around 2 years ago. The resort is a small one next to the lake. The food was reasonable. Staff polite. Advise to take lake facing room.

title: small but nice place
review: small place but worth visiting. nine cornered lake with various mythological myths. Beautiful view and lake boating.

title: gorgeous place. great view. serene atmosphere
review: initially i thought of ditching my family on day 1 when they were visiting the lake as it was too cold and i was cranky. But thankfully my husband talked me out of it, as the visit was amazing.

title: 9 corner lake
review: it's a 9 cornered lake, we did boating twice and it will just not enough. sunny day with a bit of drizzle made it more beautiful.

title: Beautiful & quite place
review: Beautiful & quite place free from hustle & bustle of Nainital.Boating in the Lake in serene environment & crystal clear waters is heavenly experience. Condition of Boat relatively better than Nainital.

title: One of the great lakes
review: Naukuchiatal is still one of the few lakes in the area where you can see the unspoiled natural beauty of the original lakes of the area.

title: Worthy lake
review: The lakes in nainital are worth to see

title: Scenic
review: A very good view and a walk around the lake will be very relaxing. There is boating and Shikara rides.

title: Peace at its threshold
review: What a pristine lake. If you are searching for peace then this is the place to be. No pollution and no crowd. Clean lake surrounded with trees and fresh air. Huge mountains on the backdrop. Just one catch- No market for shopping and less transportation.

title: Serenity
review: Naukuchiatal Lake is a very serene and placid waterbody. It is named Naukuchiatal because it has 9 corners if you look from the top. The water in the lake is very clean and placid. You can enjoy boating and some water adventures at this place. Some kids water adventures are also available. Just opposite Naukuchiatal is Kamal Tal which is known for Lotus flowers. In all a scenic place.

title: Serene
review: Went to Naukuchiatal for organising a rally. Very beautiful place. Can stay in a number of hotels around instead of heading to nainital. You can enjoy a lot of sports around. Especially Gliding. Though please check out the safety procedures provided by the specific provider.

title: Good birds, walking area and boating
review: Lovely clean lake with boating - it is good for bird watching, walking, and dragonflies too. Take in the fresh air and enjoy the peace and quiet, but don't tell too many about it.

title: Quiet - not on the beaten path
review: There's the usual paddle boating, rowing that exists at most lakes, but what we found the most fun was the kayaking. It can be done with an instructor or alone, if intrepid. I nearly fainted when we were mid lake and he mentioned its depth at that point - 900 meters!

title: Pristine lake with near absence of tourists!
review: Maybe its the time of the year I had been, early Sep is not the typical time associated with traveling unless one is an avid monsoon lover! However I do have to add that although the season may have played a part in the dramatic absence of people, top 3 things that directly work in favor of the lake and hence a case for a visit!

title: Awesome experience at the 9 corner lake
review: Naukuchiatal lies at a distance of half an hour drive from Nainital but is more pristine, quiet and stunning. The place looks like a fairy land, with long roads running parallel to the lake , excellent for horse -riding. One can also try paragliding there. Lake Resort is a good hotel to stay in and enjoy the scenic lake.

title: Lake of nine corners
review: Situated 4 km from Bhimtal, Naukuchiatal,indeed ,a beautiful place ,where you can spend hours.The lake is fed by an underground perennial spring

title: beautiful lake
review: its the second biggest lake in the Nainital district, offers yatching and boating options. the lake is nice and beautiful and u can take a walk on the road surrounding the lake.

title: Nice scenic lake, not too touristy
review: Shikaras are run by local union. People are helpful.

title: Review of Naukuchiatal
review: It's probably the best lake of Nainital. It's quite big with literally nine corners, though one can identify only six to seven corners. But the paddle boat and shikaras make it a very good experience. Add to it the new adventures like Kayaking and Paragliding..it's one of the best attractions of Nainital.

title: Very pleasant and non commercial in offseason
review: Extremely peaceful and a great walk around the lake with a lovely adrak chai at the boat house with a pure and crystal clear and tingling atmosphere

title: Needs some cleaning, otherwise nice
review: Naukuchiatal Lake is better in itself. And I personally think it is better than other lakes in its vicinity. It is a good spot for photography and sightseeing. Nature lovers will love it here. Number of water sports are available, but they are not worth the money the locals charge. You can rather enjoy the time doing water sports, in enjoying the nature. The drive to Naukuchiatal is also pleasant. The Lake is very big, and looks like a lagoon in some spots! Overall, my visit was fun and satisfactory.

title: Good for water sports
review: Uncrowded. Good quiet boat ride. Fun Zorb-like cylinder for children. Encouraging to see that administration is working to keep the water clean. Visit lakeside shops for a royal photoshoot wearing local grandiose dresses.

title: Pristine!
review: While most people give this lake a miss because of the lack of activities, that is exactly what sets it apart. Usual visitors to this lake arrive late in the morning and depart late in the noon leaving it to the kind who like the peace and calm it offers. The activities are decent for this size of a lake, but with visitors becoming more demanding the list has kept steadily increasing over the years. Recent additions are kayaking and zorbing. The lake is most beautiful early in the mornings and in the evenings when, if there's no breeze it can be as still as glass offering perfect reflections of the surrounding hills and boats. It is also great if you like slow walking along the lake, within the quaint town (which is mostly just a string of shops) or driving up to the nearby hills to get an aerial view. While the lake is relatively clean for its size, visitors don't mind littering it, but the boating association does a commendable job of atleast attempting to keep it clean.

title: Ok water body, try bhimtaal instead
review: Not as beautiful as Bhimtaal.

title: Amazing Place
review: In love with this lake.Its clean than naini lake and Bhimtal Jheel.While boating one can see the mountains and the hills clearly.

title: Quiet
review: Away from hustle bustle of Nainital. This was a quiet lake. Like other places in Uttarakhand rates were fixed. THe lake has canoeing, kayaking, zorbing and boating. IT is clean and well maintained.

title: Naukuchiatal Lake Visit
review: Its a big lake with good boating facilities paddle boats and shikara ....prices are reasonable the lake is a huge one and sorrounded by hills

title: Superb Place !
review: We enjoyed boating at the Naukuchiatal Lake and indulged in lot of adventure activities like Zorbing. Its a fun place for all.

title: Good place.
review: The place was good.One can avail boating on nominal charges. Place is smaller but beaty was good. Fishing is prohibited. Nearby restaurants are not good and heygenic.

title: An affordable paragliding destination
review: The paragliding activity is very good and a must experience. There are a number of vendors providing the service and they are easily accessible. Most of the hotel staff will often recommend some or the other vendor and also offer some discount, so look out for this.

title: beautiful
review: canoeing is must here and shikara!! it has a beautiful view and if u can watch all the nine corners it means your all wishes would be fullfilled

title: WOW
review: Amazing serenity. Not like the crowded Nainitaal and even mere serene than Bhimtaal. Boating here [we took pedal boats is amazing. So peaceful. Friendly folk too.

title: Needs cleaning up
review: Boated for an hour in the lake. It is not too clean and some areas were stinking. The lake was full of dead fish, which the locals said was because of some new machine the govt has set up near the lake.

title: Beating the retreat
review: While returning from Mukteshwar we visited the Naukuchiatal lake.  The place offers several boating options. Though I have been to Nauckuchiatal lake several times I found a new attraction for the kids especially in the shape of Zorbing.  Apart from shikara you have the option of canoeing and pedal boats.  Horserides for the kids is an option too. The place is not overcrowded like Nainital or Bhimtal.  It being a fresh water lake and being from the Kumaon region I feel that the oxygen levels in the water is depleting as i saw several dead fishes and the water was stinking. The sanitation and garbage disposal seem to be non existent as I saw heaps of plastic bottles and chip packets strewn everywhere.  The view of the mountain around and the lake is picture perfect. This is a place where you can enjoy with your kids and family

title: Tranquility & Adventure combo
review: Loved the scenery and tranquility,away from maddening crowds. Yet close to bhimtal & Sattal.Offers many adventure sport. Paragliding is special attraction.

title: AWESOME
review: Very few tourists ..... excellent conditions for pedal boating, kayaking and canoeing .... recommended for repeated visits

title: Serene surroundings
review: A lake surrounded by mountains is its beauty. The clouds touching the water enhances its presence. A place worth visiting.

title: Lake with 9 corners
review: A peaceful lake as compared to other lakes near Nainital. Specialty of this lake is that it has 9 corners and one can't see all the corners from a single point. At the max you can see 2 or 3 corners from one point.

title: Nainital - Jun 2015
review: This is part of the lake tour from Nainital. Naukuchiatal is comparatively a small lake. Got recent publicity after 'Koi Mil Gaya' Bollywood movie. Boating facility is available. From view perspective, I think it is better than Bhimtal but will score low compared to Nainital or Sattal. It is at one end; 7 KM from Bhimtal. It seems to be almost in plains and felt pretty warm during summer.

title: Beautiful and Peaceful
review: Try locating the nine corners of the lake .... it was huge and could not locate the nine corners....beautiful... didnt get a chance but i feel u shd at least spend a night here

title: The Lake Resort is a Must Go Place
review: I had wonderful experience in the Lake Resort. It is built on a sprawling space, having different types of accomodation facilities, right from tent house to horror house, grafiiti paint house, A grade hotel rooms etc.

title: amazing and secluded haven
review: Nothing to dislike unless you are fond of shops & crowds... Boating is lovely & so is the photography. family & couples.. go for it...

title: Heaven on earth
review: Nice stay, calm lake, picaresque view. Lake resort is the ideal place to stay.  Not much recreational activities to be expected. Its ideal for pleasant quite stay. Spend time with you and your loved ones :)

title: Peaceful Lake
review: Naukuchiatal not being a popular holiday spot adds more beauty and peaceful to this lake.

title: very peaceful atmosphire
review: cool calm nature friendly far away from polution lovely boating experiance one can spend a hole day there

title: Boating & karhi - Naukuchiatal
review: Peaceful and quiet place with lots to do. Activities like zorbing and zip lining as well as traditional stuff like shooting balloons and boating. The best thing about naukuchiatal is the karhi chawal and kheer available at all the dhabas lining the way down to the taal..Enjoy!!

title: EXCELLENT LAKE
review: Trekking around the lake is wonderful experience along with boating and other water sports like kayaking and zorbing

title: Really Good
review: Unlike Sattal Lake this is also well maintained property. The scenic view is so beautiful. The boating facility is available here too.

title: Nothing Great
review: One can visit Naukutchiatal Lake if staying in vicinity. Very average destination with too many people and also not one of the cleanest lakes in the area.

title: Take a lazy boat ride
review: It is said to be a nine cornered lake, but only its seven corners are noticeable today. You may like to take a lazy boat ride while you are there or maybe engage yourself in some kayaking. This place has little to offer in terms of activities as compared to the nearby more famous Bhimtal, but it certainly is more calm. You may also swim here.

title: Serene and Beautiful
review: If you want to get out of the hustle-bustle and crowd at Nainital, this is the best place to go for near Nainital. The place is so serene and peaceful, you would wish to just seat there and experience the tranquility for a long time. You can have a walk alongside the lake or you can just seat and enjoy the peaceful and scenic surroundings.

title: So Peaceful, scenic and awesome experience
review: Visited Naukuchiatal lake on our from nainital to ranikhet. Did not stay there but went for boating in the lake. Easily the best lake . Beautiful location, amazing scenic beauty. So calm, peaceful and relaxing. Next time I will stay there only. Awesome Experience.

title: Beautiful, quiet
review: We were in a hotel overlooking the lake so we walked down and were bird watching. Along came a boat which we then hired for an hour and he took us around the nine cornered, nau- kuchiya, lake. It was bliss

title: Nothing new here!
review: The lake is beautiful, but not exceptionally so as to visit it especially. It is known for bird-watching but due to harsh weather, we never spotted any.

title: best tal after nainital
review: this water body is surrounded by many sports activities like boating, kayaking, trekking, paragliding. All the outdoor fun in this region is here. Boating is pleasure and charge for a 20-30 min boat ride is Rs 200 to 250. Kids can try horse riding and ladies and small kids can go for fancy dress photography in typical native dresses. There are small stalls near the boat stand and regulars like maggie, chips, tea/coffee, rajma rice and parathas are available at very cheap prices. Lots of activities and fun place to be. If one is looking for higher end restaurants then there are very few options near the lake.

title: Peaceful easy feeling
review: Nauki as it is now known as, is a beautiful little lake, where to enjoy the low hills, you need a charming cottage and some hard working staff that will feed you well.

title: Mystic
review: Morning walks around the lake is like breath of fresh Air, infact it is Romantic sitting herewith your spouse helps rekindle the sparks

title: Better than Bhimtal
review: Peaceful place and the boats are attractive when compared to other lakes. Also whole family can get into the boat, while in Bhimtal and Nanital you are forced to take 2 adults + 2 kids ride. Cost is also less. Lake is surrounded by thick tress . Take a horse ride for 20 min. There are two spots for taking the boat. U do also have rappelling.

title: Water Body
review: Kayaking, boating, horse riding are the only things you could do here. Or maybe just sit around doing nothing. Go only if you have your own car otherwise a waste of time as similar and better services available and Bhimtal and Sattal.

title: A beautiful lake
review: Naukuchiatal is still not very commercialized as compared to Nainital... a beautiful and serene lake to do boating and canoeing. if you there one visit is sure to be there.

title: Very clean lake
review: Not too crowded, the lake has options for boating, rowing, and kayaking. It is very clean compared to many other more touristy spots.

title: Cool and Clean Lake
review: We had stayed near naukuchiya tal. It is around 5 km from the bhimtal. The lake is at lower point compare to nainital but if you want to enjoy boating I feel this is better than the naini lake. We had stayed 3 days near to it and enjoyed its beauty, surrounding landscaping and the paragliding.

title: Picture perfect
review: Its virgin and clean...

title: Nice Place
review: Awesome place.

title: Neat and Clean
review: Boating is good as well as the view. The water is clean. Its covered with forests on all sides. One can walk around the banks and explore the entire area.

title: Serenity :)
review: We sat here for a long time both days and what amazes is the sheer calm. The mist made for amazing photographs.

title: Great place to unwind
review: In a region of many lakes, this one stands out in terms of its location, beauty and range of water-based activities that it can offer.

title: Nice view
review: I didn't avail any excursion available at this lake, but I am sure the available boating and kayaking would be very good choices.

title: Nice Lake
review: This is one of the biggest lake in the region with lot of activites like boating, Kayaking etc. Rates are fixed so do not worry on getting extra charged. I has a very soothing surroundings where you can walk and enjoy the natural beauty of nature.

title: Peaceful, placid - Beautiful
review: Nestled just 6Km from the chaotic Bhimtal, this lake is serene, calm,   peaceful - Must visit if you are touring the Nainital-Bhimtal circuit.

title: Less crowded lake
review: Serene and calm lake.Lotus pound in front of Taal.Boats are in different style than avialable in mallitaal and tallitaal.

title: Pure Bliss
review: stretched over a circumference of about 3 kms with 9 corners, this lake is beautiful and is so peaceful that one can just sit in a boat and spend hours just admiring the scenic beauty or reading a book. just too good.

title: A serene lake
review: We would just sit in the room & enjoy the beauty of lake with tourists kayaking amidst clouds. One can enjoy a shikara ride reminiscent of a ride in Dal Lake.

title: Mesmerising Beauty
review: The famous Naukuchiyatal (lake)is about 25 kms from Nainital.as came to know it is135 ft deep and having in shape irregular nine corners. It's a home to an unique blend of civilisation and nature.fortunately I was with my family,there when it was full moon night and it was an experience in itself.Parichay- the most beautiful resort owned by Kumaonmandal Vikas Nigam is also here but I have no authentic information about this property except this that it was constructed by the boer war prisoners in British raj,lateron purchased by Shri G.B.Pant.people who love peace -nature-god-given beauty,lushgreen surroundings will certainly love this place.Normally people prefers to come here in sightseeing package from Nainital and not bad if somebody haven't freedom of time. I deeply regret for failure of battery of cell,bcoz of that couldn't click the beauty gifted to Uttarakhand by the god.

title: Good outing for couple of hours only
review: This a one of the 9 lakes around Nanital area, and may be smallest one, you can hire a boat, but when I traveled there was no one else, its better if go to Nanital, because there are restaurants around that place, but this place has no one, except for some ducks.

title: Good place to sit and relax
review: The lake is a great place to just sit and relax. One can simply sip cups of tea and admire the beauty.

title: Beautiful
review: It's a quite lake located away from the hustble bustle of crowded hill stations. One can opt for boating. The ducks add charm to the beauty of the lake. One can enjoy tea & hot maggi on some dhabas alongside the lake. You can also opt for horse riding in the area.

title: Naukuchiatal Lake is a very small place but the lake is very beautiful.
review: Naukuchiatal Lake is a very small place but the lake is very beautiful. Somehow I found it best place to do kayaking or boating.

title: biggest lake of nainital
review: its the biggest lake of nainital having nine corners because of which it got its name as naukuchiatal. its a nice and beautiful lake with boating facilities also

title: An excellent place offering peace and adventure at the same place
review: Naukuchiatal is close to Bhimtal but is much more peaceful and serene than Bhimtal. There are lot of boating and adventurous activities in the lake. A very good place for watching birds.

title: Skip if already seen other lakes of the area
review: Nothing special about the lake , if you had already visited other "tals" of the area than skip this one , only "hanuman garhi " is worth visiting

title: Cleanest lake I ever saw in India!
review: Do not go there if you are an irresponsible polluter of nature. Preserve this beauty of a lake and swim there or take a boat ride. It is just wonderful.

title: Thanks
review: Better than bhimtal.  Lake is clean and tidy.  Good place for a half day trip. Paragliding is also available

title: A lake with nine corners
review: Naukuchiatal means ‘lake of nine corners’ is a small hill station in Nainital, Uttarakhand. It is situated at a distance of 24 km from Nainital and about 4 kms from BhimTal. The lake is 175 feet deep and is situated at 1220m above sea level. It is surrounded by hills covered with Oak trees and shrubs. It is the deepest of all the lakes in this region. Length of lake is 983m, breadth is 693m & depth is 40.3m. The valley offers an opportunity of angling and bird watching. One can do rowing, paddling or yachting in the lake. The lake is less crowded as compared to other lakes of the region. The rates are fixed by the local administration. Lot of ducks and other birds are there in the lake. The lake is fed by an underground perennial spring.

title: Good and calm
review: This was my 4th visit to the lake.I always found it enjoyable and tranquil.The peddle boating is nothing great but shikara type rowing boat was very relaxing especially with narration by knowledgeable boatman cum guide.Then next morning we went Kayaking and Canoeing which was pretty challenging considering my age.The boat stations are dirty but lotus pond on the northern side is very beautiful ,so are few areas on the southern edge ,good for picnic.

title: good for kayaking
review: This is another tal (lake) near bhimtal where you can do pedal boating & kayaking. We took 2 kayaks for 600/- for half hour ride.

title: TRANQUIL SERENE AND CLEANER
review: Although barely five kms from Bhimtal, this area is much more cleaner and hence more inviting.In addition it has more activities than Bhimtal and hence is much more fun. One can do a number of adventure activities like paragliding,kayaking,boating ,trekking, horse riding etc and  that too at affordable rates. There are better hotels for all.

title: The calm and beautiful Lake - Nakuchiatal
review: This was my first (family) trip to Nainital region.

title: Lovely
review: Naukuchia Tal, literally, Nine-Cornered Lake, is 26 km (16 mi) from Nainital and 4 km from Bhimtal at an altitude of 1,220 m (4,000 ft). The lake is almost 1 km (0.62 mi) long, 0.5 km (0.31 mi) wide and approximately 40 m (130 ft) deep. It is the deepest of the lakes in the greater Naintal area. According to legend, if one takes in all nine corners in one glimpse, one can disappear in a cloud of smoke. (See excerpts from J. W. M'Crindle on the Literary references to Nainital page.)

title: Calm & Serene
review: Its decently non-commercial and surprisingly clean .. You can hire a variety of boats, I would suggest the paddling one .. Paddle away and relax ... Enjoy the sights and sounds of the water rippling around ... and sun on your face ... preferable time is around the sun set to have a spectacular view of glistening lake in last rays of the sun !

title: Peaceful place
review: One of the Beautiful lakes in Nainital, located 4 km away from Bhimtal. Peaceful place free from crowd, surrounded by mountains ideal for relaxation. You can also enjoy boat ride here. Nine-Cornered Lake, is 26 km from Nainital at an altitude of 1,220 m (4,000 ft). The lake is almost 1 km long, 0.5 km wide and approximately 40 m (130 ft) deep. It is the deepest of the lakes in the greater Naintal area. According to legend, if one takes in all nine corners in one glimps

title: Biggest Lake around Nainital
review: This lake is the biggest among all the lakes in Nainital. This lake has 9 corners.We had a boat ride in the lake and enjoyed every bit of it although we could not cover the whole lake due to winds.This place has very few hotels/houses around it which makes it quiet and peaceful.A must visit place if you are in Nainital.

title: Beautiful Lake
review: Its big natural lake with 9 corners. It has boating facilities like Kayaking, Canoying and paddle boats

title: Less crowded , hence enjoyable
review: Well, it doesn't boast of the fame of Nainital Lake and the market , the buzz around . What it offers  is  a serene atmosphere, cool boat ride , a few  birds flying , a splash or two from not-so-big fishes , a few bird species flying ( we spotted a pair of Himalayan eagles and  a couple of  old friends-owls) . Ideal place  to laze around .

title: Beautiful lake surrouneded by hills
review: I found this lake very beautiful. It is very big lake and very good for puddle boating. We took 1 paddle boat for 4 and enjoyed 1 hour boating. It was awesome experience to be there. Just be there and you will forget all the hustle bustle of routine life.

title: Beautiful !
review: Serene and so much peace around !

title: peaceful with surrounded hills
review: In here amazing view.lake 25 km far from nainital.This lake is less crowded and lake around by beautiful hill.In here boating is very enjoyable.

title: Cute cocooned corner at Lake View Guest House
review: The one quiet joint around this area cried from the top of the most popular hotel lawns at highest possible decibels last week when the Escape Festival of Art and Music was celebrated.

title: Serene and peaceful
review: The boat ride was soothing with lots of birds to watch as a bonus. The boatmen are friendly and will tell you about their town with pride. Naukuchiatal is the poor cousin of Nainital and so less crowded and more enjoyable

title: Quite, Serene and ideal place for relaxing vacation
review: If you are bored with typical hill station visits of going to view points, boating, mall roads and just want to relax this is place to be..cute little town ..with very less visitors ..and a complete relaxation..

title: most peacefull getaway
review: naukuchiatal is one of the most picturesque of all the lakes in this area and offers great options for adventure activities.

title: Serene
review: The lake is less commercial than others in the area and living on the perimeter properties would ensure peaceful stay. If you're looking for cubby-holes on a livel street, please head to Nainitaal.

title: One of the Best Lakes in the country
review: Beautiful blue waters surrounded by lush green Trees, this lake is supposed to have 9 sides (Nau-Kuchia Taal). The boating experiences in the sun and shade (of the hills and the trees), with clean and fresh air makes it an amazing experience. The lake is so big, that you can't see all 9 sides of the lakes from any part of the lake. You will have to climb high up the hills (perhaps) to find a location from which you can see all the sides.

title: Nice place to spend time
review: It is a big lake surrounded by mountains. There are 3 kinds of boats for boating Paddle(2 & 4 seater), Rowing(4 seater), & Shikara(5-8 seater).

title: Serenity
review: A very beautiful lake, probably unexplored by most of travelers to Nainital. But, a must visit lake. One can enjoy Kayaking as well in the lake.

title: Once in a lifetime experience
review: I have been in Nainital on a short trip. On the way from Bhimtaal to Naukuchiataal, we see paragliding. Our driver insist that it is safe and give you lot's of fun. We reach there with bumping hearts and decided to have this experience. At first, you may be feared about safety and ability of pilots of paragliders. But once you take-off, it is deadsure that IT WILL BE A LIFETIME EXPERIENCE....

title: Lovely place to spend a peaceful evening
review: We had a nice time in the shikara this Feb. The person who was rowing the shikara shared a scary story behind the lake's changing colours & the suicide cases linked to it. Apart from that story, I can only recollect fond memories from the lovely evening I spent with my family.

title: Offbeat
review: Not many would know of its existence. But those who come here will not be disappointed. Enchanting in its own way... away from the hustle and bustle of Nainital or even Bhimtal for that matter.

title: Quaint
review: The lake with nine corners - its a small lake which is not over crowded and commercialized yet (lets hope it stays that way). Their is a pier from where you can go boating on the lake and also a walking path along the lake.

title: Centre of Universe!!
review: Unlike anything I've experienced before!! Please look at the review I've submitted to Trip advisor regarding this Location. Like the Taj.....a gem within India 2012 style!! I'll be returning again, and I have/will be advising collegues to visit + stay for btheir own experience!!

title: Lake is too sad
review: Near the Lake there are no activates. No seating arrangements. Only boating is what you can do near the lake

title: Great Driver - Sanjay
review: Four of us reached Kathgodam by Shatabdi from Delhi and then called Anand Bisht ( driver, whose number has been provided in many websites by reviewers like me). He provided us the contact of this guy Sanjay 09759730964. He has a Alto and is a wonderful driver. We planned to visit Nainital, Binsar, Kausani, Ranikhet and of course the "Tal"s....and he was with us...He charged Rs 1500 per day, which I thought was reasonable given the distance he covered.

title: Green, Peaceful and Wild
review: It was midnight when we reached at hotel..KMVN parichey ..moon was glimmering in lake ..suddenly we heard call of barking deer..  we were told a barking deer call is very common here as surrounding is full of forest.

title: Lovely peaceful place for birding
review: Naukuchiatal lake, unlike its close neighbours Bhimtal and Nainital lakes, is a Lovely peaceful place for birding. One can take long or short strolls along the lake and stopping at any place, one can hear many bird calls and spot several birds.

title: Quiet lake....
review: The boating options are good. You can do Kayaking out here which is not there in Bhimtal and Nainital lakes. The rates are on higher side than nainital. Its much beautiful in nainital lakes also..

title: Placidity
review: Its a calm serene n placid lake to begin with. one or two adventure activities r also there. People here r friendly. Rates r reasonable. I hired a boat for 400 rs.full family. 30 minutes r sufficient time to soak in rejuvenate ur mind

title: Beautiful
review: Naukuchiatal lake is very beautiful n serene. Since Naukuchital is not much commercialised yet, there was less crowd,which was the best part. There are lots of water activities available.we did boating and kayaking on this lake.

title: A morning well spent
review: There is direct access to the lake from within the resort. We went for canoe rides and boat rides in the lake.

title: Must visit lake amidst nature
review: You should definitely visit Naukuchiatal if you prefer a calm and peaceful vacation away from the hustle and bustle of the city. There are plenty of boutique resorts and hotels close to the lake. During your next trip around this part of the country, skip Nainital and go for Naukuchiatal.

title: Nice lake with all the adventure games
review: Nice lake with all the adventure games like zip lining, kayaking, paddle boating etc. There are not many places to eat nearby.

title: Serene green lake,
review: Beautiful placid lake ,had a lovely shikaara ride and a lake side KMVN property to just sit quietly and read

title: Picturesque.
review: Located at 4 km from Bhimtal, and 26 km from Nainital, the deepest of all the lakes in the Nainital region, Naukuchital is serene and picturesque lake, which offers numerous water sports if one has an appetite for adventure.

title: Pisturesque - Must visit
review: Located in Naukuchiatal. This lake has nine corners and it huge. Many cafes, restaurants , hotel options nearby. One can do boating as well.

title: A nice quiet lake
review: There are no touristic hordes around this lake. It is said that going around the nine corners of the lake gives moksha to the person.
